entry.summary: Java has been a powerhouse in the world of programming for decades. From enterprise-level applications to Android apps, Java’s versatility makes it one of the most sought-after skills in the tech industry. But becoming a professional Java developer? That’s a journey filled with learning, practice, and a bit of strategy. If you’ve ever wondered how to stand out in this competitive field, you’re in the right place. Let me walk you through the 7 best tips to become a pro Java developer—tips that can accelerate your career and sharpen your coding skills. Also Read:- How To Start Learning Java Programming The first step on your journey is to build a solid foundation. Java isn’t just about writing code that works; it’s about writing code that’s clean, efficient, and maintainable. Spend time mast…

entry.title: End-to-end testing and deployment of a multi-agent AI system with Docker, LangGraph, and CircleCI
entry.summary: Multi-agent AI systems are transforming how intelligent applications are built. By orchestrating multiple specialized agents that collaborate to solve complex tasks, these systems enable more dynamic and efficient workflows. However, deploying such a system reliably and at scale requires a structured approach to testing, packaging, and automation. In this tutorial, you will walk through the process of building, testing, and deploying a multi-agent AI system using LangGraph, Docker, AWS Lambda, and CircleCI. You will develop a research-driven AI workflow where different agents,such as fact-checking, summarization, and search agents, work together seamlessly. You will package this application into a Docker container, deploy it to AWS Lambda, and automate the entire pipeline using CircleCI. B…

entry.title: What Comes First When Writing Documentation—The Product or The Users?
entry.summary: Many times when I’ve had to visit product documentation for clarity or an introduction to a product, I ended up spending far more time than I intended. Why? Because finding the information I needed was unnecessarily difficult. Some documentation does a great job of explaining all the features of a product. But that’s all they do. It’s obvious they didn’t consider how users might actually interact with the product. Their goal was simply to write as much product information as possible, without bothering to ask how the user might need to use their product or how that should influence the design and development of the documentation. On the other end of the spectrum, I’ve seen documentation that focused on users, but did it poorly. These docs often skimped on critical details. Important refere…

entry.title: Developers Will Be Replaced by AI? Nah, We Can Do Everything Now
entry.summary: Once, everyone said “Learn to code.” We can learn everything. They tried to break into our world. They thought we’d get replaced by AI. capable of doing almost everything. We became the Swiss Army knife — not the tool itself, but the person holding it. With AI as our orchestra: We’re conductors of the full product lifecycle. We’re Jedis, using the Force of AI to master entire domains — strategy, design, marketing, finance, supply chain, legal. We don’t stop at code. We build the entire business. While they struggled with “Hello World,” we automated their entire workflow before lunch. Yes, it’s exhilarating. But also: Quality control is chaos. Decision fatigue is real. The loneliness of command? Yep, it hits. But that’s the game now: And here’s the thing: So here's my question for fellow solo flyers: What does YOUR daily AI routine look like? Drop your rituals below — let’s trade stories of our solo Jedi life. 🧘‍♂️ Full post → goker.me/developers-replaced-ai-one-person-army

entry.title: Day:4 Building a Simple Counter App with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
entry.summary:
Today, I created a small but useful application Counter App using basic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It’s a great little project for beginners and a handy way to reinforce fundamental web development skills. Let me walk you through how I built it and what it does. This counter app displays a number (starting from 0) and provides three buttons: ➕ Increase: Adds 1 to the counter
➖ Decrease: Subtracts 1 from the counter
🔁 Reset: Resets the counter back to 0
It’s interactive, responsive, and runs right in the browser—no frameworks required! Here’s the complete HTML code that includes the structure and the JavaScript logic: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>Counter App</title…

entry.title: Telegram Bot Store on Python: Step-by-Step Guide with Payment, Catalog, and Admin Panel (Aiogram 3 + SQLAlchemy 2)
entry.summary:
Friends, hello! Today I come to you with a new practical project in Python. This time we will create a full-fledged Telegram bot for selling digital goods with a database that we will manage via SQLAlchemy 2, an admin panel, a user part and integrated payment via Yukasa. I will take you step by step through all the stages of developing such a bot: from registering a token in BotFather to deploying the finished product on a remote hosting so that the bot can work smoothly 24/7 without being tied to your computer or Internet connection. But first things first. In this project, we will work exclusively with Python, so those who do not like JavaScript can relax today. We use the following technologies: Aiogram 3 — the best asynchronous Python framework for developing Telegram bots.
SQLAlchem…

entry.title: Building a smarter Web scraper: Vector embeddings for intelligent content retrieval and analysis

Yet Another Scraper? This One's Actually Worth Your Time!
Hey there, fellow code wranglers! 👋 Alex here, and today I'm going to introduce you to my latest python creation - (and yes, I will do a Rust lang follow-up if this gets enough attention). Whether you're just starting your coding journey or you've got a few years under your belt as a developer, this project is designed to be both educational and immediately useful. Entry-level devs will find the codebase approachable with clear patterns to learn from, while mid-level engineers can appreciate the architecture choices and extend the functionality for their specific needs - it is meant to be a starting point for you to build upon. This isn't just any scraper. It's a full-stack solution that combines FastAPI, PostgreSQL with pgvector…

entry.title: Controle de fumaça em edifícios residenciais: proteja sua segurança
entry.summary: Nos ambientes residenciais, a segurança dos moradores vai além de sistemas tradicionais de combate a incêndios, envolvendo também estratégias eficazes de controle de fumaça. A fumaça, muitas vezes invisível a olho nu, representa uma ameaça silenciosa que pode rapidamente comprometer a vida e a saúde dos residentes durante uma emergência. Sua capacidade de se espalhar rapidamente pelos ambientes dificultando a evacuação e aumentando o risco de intoxicação torna o controle de fumaça uma prioridade essencial na concepção e manutenção de edifícios residenciais modernos. sistemas de controle de fumaça , como barreiras, ventilação controlada e detectores especializados, garante não apenas a proteção do patrimônio, mas, principalmente, a integridade física e emocional das pessoas que ali habitam.…

entry.title: This benchmark used Reddit’s AITA to test how much AI models suck up to us
entry.summary: Back in April, OpenAIannounced it was rolling back an update to its GPT-4o model that made ChatGPT’s responses to user queries too sycophantic. An AI model that acts in an overly agreeable and flattering way is more than just annoying.
